articles.title: MRF at Rs 1 lakh: Is it an 'expensive' stock? - Moneycontrol
articles.description: MRF never split the face value of its shares. In 1970 and 1975, it gave bonus shares in the ratio of 1:2 and 3:10. Over the past 10 years, sales have compounded at 9-10 percent, while the stock has compounded at 22 percent per year
articles.content:
India got its first six-digit stock on June 13  Madras Rubber Factory (MRF). But imagine investing Rs 1 lakh in one stock. Just one. No wonder, retail investors have deemed the stock 'expensive'.
